name: 13. Never Burning Out.
description:
"It would be months until the smoke cleared, as the embers ate their way through the wood and converted it into ashy carbon. At dark you could see little spots of glow dotted over every hill, on the edges of the forests there were fallen trees smoldering on the ground, some even still standing with sparks pouring out of their heads. Through all this I found, eventually, a place of strength. Though we could be burned out and left to sweep away the soot and discard the fragments, it couldn't take away our hearts. Now we say, come at us world. We have endured the flames and when the pain had cleared and the losses set free, we were if anything warmer. Ever burning." 

Photography by Jay Moon, during the Australian wildfires; November 2019.
#13 of 15.
All funds generated go toward the ongoing recovery.
